intro: Vitaliana congesta, commonly known as the clustered vitalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly rough texture. Vitaliana congesta is typically found in rocky outcrops and dry shrublands, where it thrives in full sun.
